Women's hockey prevail on penalties

The women's hockey firsts came out on top in an epic encounter with Durham this afternoon, winning 2-1 on penalty flicks to progress into the next round of the BUCS Cup

Late Vanbrugh penalty snatches point from Alcuin

An 89th minute penalty from Callum Woodall rescued a point for Vanbrugh today, after Alcuin had taken the lead ten minutes before the end of the first half

High five for Wentworth as they demolish Langwith

Wentworth produced a vintage second half performace on 22 Acres today, as the post-graduates put five past Langwith without reply

James prevail in tight Goodricke encounter

Goals from Andrew Jopson and James Briars secured a hard-fought win for James in their clash with Goodricke on the 3G Pitch

Tennis firsts held at Northumbria

York's men's tennis first team continued their undefeated start to the season with a closely fought draw against a strong Northumbria side

Physical James thrash depleted Goodricke

A highly impressive and disciplined display from the forwards and an assured performance from fly-half Charlie Burton helped James romp to a devastating 67-5 win over Goodricke today

Classy Newcastle too strong for women's hockey seconds

An impressive Newcastle team overcame a spirited York side with a 4-0 victory on the JLD

Early York goals claim three points from Durham

Two goals in the first five minutes were enough to give the hockey firsts a well-earned three points in their win over Durham thirds on the JLD

Derwent's Ed boy stars in resounding win

A virtuoso performance from Ed Kemp helped Derwent College continue their impressive start to the season with a resounding 55-7 victory over Halifax this afternoon

Netball firsts cruise past Sheffield

York's netball first team put on a dominant display today to see them take a 36-20 victory over Sheffield seconds

Impressive rugby firsts dismantle Leeds Met

A hat-trick of tries from Will Sharp helped the men's rugby firsts on their way to recording a dominant 35-13 victory over Leeds Met on 22 Acres this afternoon

Wentworth hold Vanbrugh in season opener

A late Elliot Rous-Ross goal secured Vanbrugh a draw against a determined Wentworth side in their opening game of the Autumn Term League

James' cutting edge proves too much for Halifax

An impressive display by James College was enough to see off Halifax on 22 acres today

Trant double hands Derwent opening win

Derwent got off to a winning start in their college football campaign as they beat Alcuin 2-0 at a foggy 22 Acres

Goodricke clinch win in Hes East derby

A brace of first-half goals from Rob Young was enough to earn Goodricke a win despite a determined Langwith comeback in the encounter between the Heslington East colleges

Derwent display intent with dominant win over Alcuin

Derwent's college rugby players recorded a crushing 52-0 win over Alcuin College today shortly before a half time forfeit from the Alcuin players

Women's rugby take positives from Hull defeat

Despite a loss, UYWRUFC began the new season with a promising start, demonstrating plenty of potential in a new side

Rugby seconds thrashed in Durham

The men's rugby seconds endured a tough day at the office, as they were beaten 80-5 by Durham thirds on Wednesday

Women's basketball hold their nerve to record opening win

York's women's basketball team held their nerve today against a testing Northumbria side to secure a 39 - 32 victory in their first game of the new season

Men's basketball team edged out in thriller

The men's basketball first team suffered a narrow defeat in their fixture against Sunderland this afternoon

UYAFC share the spoils in dynamic Durham clash

On a sun-drenched 22 acres, York played out an entertaining draw with Durham's second string, with both sides ultimately deserving a point

Winning start for women's badminton

The women's badminton firsts got their BUCS campaign off to the perfect start, as a superb performance in the doubles matches saw them edge a tight match with Northumbria

Women's football brush aside Leeds Trinity

York got their campaign off to a perfect start with a 5-1 demolition of Leeds Trinity

Badminton men held to a draw by Hull

The men's badminton firsts had to settle for a 4-4 draw with Varsity rivals Hull in today's season opener

UYRUFC claim tight win over College Barbarians

The University rugby team battled to a hard-fought win over a College Barbarian side this afternoon, beating their opponents 12-5

Rugby firsts make winning start

The men's rugby firsts got York's BUCS campaign off to a great start this afternoon, as they secured a 28-6 win over Manchester Met on 22 Acres

York clubs have high hopes for the new season ahead

Nouse talks to some of the University's top teams before the new campaign (Thumbnail credit Image: Philippa Grafton)

There concern among sports clubs over an increase in the cost of renting Sports Centre facilities (Thumbnail credit Image: Phlippa Grafton)

After a summer of sensational sport that has captivated the nation, we find ourselves in the rather more humble surroundings of the University of York
